issues.title: Update/rails 5 n 2017
issues.body:
Update of test matrix & license year to keep it alive.  :love_letter:

Maybe we should drop rails 3.2 since its unsupported?

commit.message:
Merge pull request #10 from mirego/update/upgrade-to-rspec-3.1

Upgrade to RSpec 3.1
Update copyright year and remove Coveralls
Keep on passing the view as argument
Move lots of important code away from Bourgeois::ViewHelper

Merge pull request #9 from mirego/feature/handle-struct-objects

Handle a Struct-based objects

Merge pull request #8 from mirego/feature/custom-presenter-class-tests

Add tests for custom presenter class
Add tests for custom presenter class

Merge pull request #7 from mirego/feature/public-object

Update object method in Presenter to make it public
Update object method in Presenter to make it public
Update About Mirego section in README
Do not raise errors with new instance
Update tests to make sure the block is not executed

Merge pull request #6 from phildionne/fix/handle-nil-object

Handle Nil objects in #present

Merge pull request #5 from mirego/feature/prevent-presenting-presenters

Prevent presenting presenters

Revert "Merge pull request #4 from mirego/feature/composition-not-inheritance"

This reverts commit a653ef0915d2ea60f1a89cdf8c027604d5993dab, reversing
changes made to 1cabc3cacdf3ee14ee486f809fb1fc94e84306a7.

Merge pull request #4 from mirego/feature/composition-not-inheritance

Use composition over inheritance

Merge pull request #3 from mirego/feature/custom-block-helpers

Add “Custom block helpers” section in README.md
Fix code to take both if and unless into account
Add Custom block helpers section in README.md
Add horizontal rule below the logo in README.md
Use a smaller logo in README.md
Add Presenter#object and tests for it

Merge pull request #2 from mirego/feature/view-helper-tests

Add tests for Bourgeois::ViewHelper

Merge pull request #1 from mirego/feature/tests

Add tests for Bourgeois::Presenter
Add description and summary in gemspec

pull_requests.title: Update/rails 5 n 2017
pull_requests.body:
Update of test matrix & license year to keep it alive.  :love_letter:

Maybe we should drop rails 3.2 since its unsupported?

repo.name: bourgeois
repo.description: :tophat: Bourgeois is a Ruby library that makes using presenters a very simple thing.

repo.name: bourgeois
repo.description: :tophat: Bourgeois is a Ruby library that makes using presenters a very simple thing.

issue_comments.body: :shipit:
Yep, I think this could be a cool feature to have :shipit:
Do it!
I added the implementation for `Bourgeois::Presenter.helper` and a few basic tests (enough for a quite simple feature).

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/274401/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/274401)

Coverage remained the same when pulling **5a42b0d8ae349e487074f62ec5a1a5b0e70655af on feature/custom-block-helpers** into **849dd79c0807908d74988cc39a41a64a8be7419c on master**.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/278923/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/278923)

Coverage remained the same when pulling **e8b7b889e0ea6161d8097057818055138db2e3e1 on feature/composition-not-inheritance** into **1cabc3cacdf3ee14ee486f809fb1fc94e84306a7 on master**.
lgtm :+1:

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/381602/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/381602)

Coverage remained the same when pulling **766efd973563111427f57cd0d3a453dc14a0e36f on phildionne:fix/handle-nil-object** into **bb78dbe4e4d92f3f29f1e0fa137a029602b595fb on mirego:master**.
Thanks for the pull request! I merged it and update a few tests. :smile:

> where I needed to original object presented in my view

When do you need the original object when all presenter methods are forwarded to it?

> When do you need the original object when all presenter methods are forwarded to it?

I'm taking this example out of its context so it might not make sense to you, but sometimes I'll want to pass the original object class to a partial or an helper. If i do `presenter.class`, I'll get `MyObjectPresenter` instead of `MyObject`.

Anyway, I don't see the point in blocking that behavior.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/516907/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/516907)

Coverage remained the same when pulling **b0f8d6b0d4b2a25bbdf5365bc8c3635013211785 on feature/public-object** into **1d67d43bde09b22321faa43bb06bacdd883b263a on master**.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/883576/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/883576)

Coverage remained the same when pulling **ede3e3a9986726e93751d300d21757dfbabce6c7 on feature/custom-presenter-class-tests** into **505c23f92310c857805c4c47de9b2980f3f963db on master**.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/885491/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/885491)

Coverage remained the same when pulling **85067da45559ad02561f35eef549e0752971d0ce on feature/handle-struct-objects** into **5c9cf7564337b8ee9d540c27f4171c47d87b78b8 on master**.
As simple as that :+1:

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +26,32 @@ def self.human_attribute_name(*args)
       klass.human_attribute_name(*args)
     end
 
+    # Declare a new block helper method
+    #
+    # @example
+    #   class UserPresenter < Bourgeois::Presenter
+    #     helper :with_profile, if: -> { profile.present? }
+    #   end
+    #
+    #   presenter = UserPresenter.new(User.new(profile: 'Foo'))
+    #   presenter.with_profile do
+    #     puts 'User has a profile:'
+    #     puts presenter.profile
+    #   end
+    def self.helper(name, opts = {})
+      define_method(name) do |&block|
+        execute = if opts[:if]
review_comments.body: I think this will not work if an `if` AND an `unless` are passed in `opts`.

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +26,32 @@ def self.human_attribute_name(*args)
       klass.human_attribute_name(*args)
     end
 
+    # Declare a new block helper method
+    #
+    # @example
+    #   class UserPresenter < Bourgeois::Presenter
+    #     helper :with_profile, if: -> { profile.present? }
+    #   end
+    #
+    #   presenter = UserPresenter.new(User.new(profile: 'Foo'))
+    #   presenter.with_profile do
+    #     puts 'User has a profile:'
+    #     puts presenter.profile
+    #   end
+    def self.helper(name, opts = {})
+      define_method(name) do |&block|
+        execute = if opts[:if]
review_comments.body: Exactly. We want to give priority to `if`.

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +26,32 @@ def self.human_attribute_name(*args)
       klass.human_attribute_name(*args)
     end
 
+    # Declare a new block helper method
+    #
+    # @example
+    #   class UserPresenter < Bourgeois::Presenter
+    #     helper :with_profile, if: -> { profile.present? }
+    #   end
+    #
+    #   presenter = UserPresenter.new(User.new(profile: 'Foo'))
+    #   presenter.with_profile do
+    #     puts 'User has a profile:'
+    #     puts presenter.profile
+    #   end
+    def self.helper(name, opts = {})
+      define_method(name) do |&block|
+        execute = if opts[:if]
review_comments.body:
This is not how `ActiveRecord` does it.

This will never execute:

``` ruby
  before_validation :do_something, if: ->{ true }, unless: ->{ true }
```

review_comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +26,32 @@ def self.human_attribute_name(*args)
       klass.human_attribute_name(*args)
     end
 
+    # Declare a new block helper method
+    #
+    # @example
+    #   class UserPresenter < Bourgeois::Presenter
+    #     helper :with_profile, if: -> { profile.present? }
+    #   end
+    #
+    #   presenter = UserPresenter.new(User.new(profile: 'Foo'))
+    #   presenter.with_profile do
+    #     puts 'User has a profile:'
+    #     puts presenter.profile
+    #   end
+    def self.helper(name, opts = {})
+      define_method(name) do |&block|
+        execute = if opts[:if]
review_comments.body: You’re absolutely right. I refactored the code (and the tests) so that if `if` and `unless` are provided, both need to _match_ in order for the helper block to be executed.
